Anyways, just some random thoughts sobriety and substance use.

Whatever you decide to put in your body, remember: Your body is a temple. 

Treat it that way.  

End/

1125229470682472448.text:
But one thing I never want to reintroduce is cigarettes. 

After quitting cigs for about 17 months, I’ve realized that is something I never want to start again.

4/

1125229469629763584.text:
So, if I do decide to reintroduce alcohol, weed, and/or other experiences back into my life, I want to do it on a very conscious level.

I want to make sure that I am treating these substances and myself with respect.

I believe this is super fuckin’ important.

3/

1125229468308520960.text:
I am looking at the potential of reintroducing some of these experiences back into my life, in a healthy manner.

I really believe that most substances can be either used to benefit or to take away from the experience of life. 

It all depends on how you choose to use them.

2/

1125229467381592070.text:
Sobriety for me was never a long term plan.

My reason for going sober was to instill balance back in my life and build a better relationship with myself.

Over the last 17 months or so, I have found a solid center within myself and I’m proud of how much progress I’ve made.

1/

1124051433408561152.text:
About 2-3 years ago, I was working in kitchens, washing dishes, and cooking.

I hated my life.

I was angry at everyone else who was succeeding more than me.

I was stuck.

As I started to work through my emotional struggles, life opened up more.

If you’re stuck, keep going.

1117174373171863552.text:
- Create an Entry Strategy: Figure out how much you want to invest, when you want to invest, and how to properly invest before pulling the trigger.

- Create an Exit Strategy: Figure out how much you want to make. Plan to exit when you are in the green. Don’t get greedy.

1117174372270133248.text:
- Build an Investment Strategy: Are you a day trader? A swing trader? or a HODLer? Know where you fit in before you start investing.

- Stay Secure: Learn the best ways to store your crypto. Learn about private keys. Get a hardware wallet. Keep your crypto safe.

1117174371129278464.text:
- Be Aware of Who You Trust: There are people trying to scam you. Never send anyone via the internet money before they verify their credentials.

- Educate Yourself: This movement is about much more than money. Even if you are only here to get rich, learn some of the basics.

1117174370261037056.text:
/Thread

Tips for New People Coming into $Crypto:

- Be Patient: Don’t rush into investing too much before you feel comfortable

- Figure Out Your Why: Why are you investing? Why are you interested in Bitcoin? Is it all about a quick $ or do you want to build something’s bigger?

And I think this is a huge issue with aspiring entrepreneurs in today’s world.

1098436807744663552.text:
Entrepreneurship is hard. 

It’s nonstop. 

It takes effort, time, and patience.

It’s not something that happens overnight. Or in a week. Or many times, even within years.

It’s something I’m still learning about cause I’m not expert. I hope to be great at it one day.

1098436805190242305.text:
I think this is a huge issue for aspiring entrepreneurs. 

A lot of people want to become entrepreneurs because of the hopes of a glamours lifestyle and simplicity/ease.

These hopes are painted by false gurus that try to manipulate for profit.

They are simply not true.

1098436802833072129.text:
After I gained more experience attempting entrepreneurship, I saw that the ways these false gurus were using were immoral. 

It went against my belief systems, so I immediately changed my habits and practices.

I realized I didn’t want to be like these “successful” people.

1098436800450707456.text:
Thankfully, no one was harmed in the process. I did not scam a single person.

Does this make these method I was using to sell right? No.

But I do attribute going through that phase a lot to who I am now. I learned a lot.

And I always had the best intentions behind my actions.

1098436797950873601.text:
I tried to make some products and services under model, and none of them were successful. At all. They all failed.

I attribute this to going against my nature.

I was young and impressionable. I thought this was the way to an entrepreneur.

I made mistakes.

I was wrong.

1098436795585286144.text:
So I follow their models. I figured that if I could model myself after successful people, then eventually I would become successful.

Sadly, this involved marketing tactics that today are known to be scammy or unethical.

1098436793156886528.text:
I was deceived by this method when I was younger.

I followed people like Tai and other lifestyle entrepreneurs. I was 20 years old and that lifestyle was super appeasing to me. 

I wanted fast cars, beautiful women, and lots of money.

1098436790413750273.text:
People like Tai Lopez are founders of this movement.

They make it seem easy to make large sums of money with very little effort and, in return, have the lifestyle of your dreams.

It promotes a get rich quick mindset and portrays that being an entrepreneur is easy.

It is not.

1098436787255500800.text:
False Entrepreneurship Thread/

There are a lot of false entrepreneurs giving the wrong impression to young aspiring entrepreneurs in the world.

This is done via the portrayal of a lifestyle: fast cars, nice watches, beautiful women, etc. 

Pretty much the “instagram” lifestyle.

1089279434975338496.text:
Over the years I have been attempting to be an entrepreneur, I have learned that perseverance is key. 

This is something I am proud to have engrained into who I am as a person.

Now you know a little more about what makes me tick.  

Love me or hate me - I am me.

Much love.

1089279433884815360.text:
I tell this story because it shows that failure shouldn’t stop you. Ever. 

Am I “successful” now? Some people might say so but I don’t think I am. 

I still hustle daily. I still want to be better. In my mind, I am not “successful.”

1089279432815198210.text:
Then, mid-2017, my buddy hits me up and says I need to look into crypto.

It was around the same time I had wrecked my car, wasn’t working because of it, and had received some insurance money.

So I had some time and resources on my hands.

And my REAL journey in crypto started.

1089279431368237057.text:
So for about 2+ years I struggled with my emotions as I faced homelessness and much more. 

Finally, after getting myself on my feet, I worked a few days jobs in kitchens and automotive places. 

These jobs helped me re-integrate with society, ground myself, and gather my mind.

1089279430281830401.text:
Frustrated and clearly misunderstanding where I was failing, I turned to making hip-hop music as an avenue of creativity. 

It was fun. I enjoyed being creative. But it soon failed as my relationship fell apart and my life was flipped upside down.

1089279429275279360.text:
I support this man and his family by buying their jewelry and then reselling it in America and online to people really appreciated it. 

It was a win-win-win situation.

But I didn’t take my finances seriously, spent most of the profit on drugs rather than expansion, and failed.

1089279428084023298.text:
During the same time, I traveled to Mexico and met a street artist with some of the most amazing wire wraps I had ever seen. 

They were made of unique crystals and other objects that I was attracted to at the time and that my community loved.

So I started Jedi Jewelry.

1089279426905419776.text:
Throughout this journey, I found myself deeply in love and spending a lot of my time/energy nurturing a relationship. My first REAL love.

I’m not going to get into this, as relationships are personal.

1089279425177362433.text:
Throughout this time, I also had small little passion ventures like podcasts and YouTune video series. 

I was really in a major exploration phase of my life - learning more about reality and the role I play in it.

It was fun and I regret none of it.

1089279423977869314.text:
Meditation and mindfulness wasn’t very popular back then, so I figured I would attempt to share what I learned with people.

I had a few clients thay changed their lives because of my calls and did great things.

But overall, coaching wasn’t very successful.

1089279422929256449.text:
Multiple of these books became best sellers on the Amazon Kindle market in multiple categories.

At the time, I was hanging in a spiritual crowd and getting more and more “hippie.” It was what I wanted to explore at the time.

Almost everyone was a “life coach” and so I followed.

1089279421998080001.text:
So I backpacked around Costa Rica for a writing and “finding myself” - whatever that means. 

After about 3 months, I moved back to the states and finished writing my book. I actually wrote a few in this time span, all about increasing positivity, meditation, and mindfulness.

1089279420970479616.text:
The end of SociaLink was also the beginning of me starting to become a hippie. 

With the over consumption of psychedelics, I found myself questioning more things than was probably healthy.

After a 5 day trip to Costa Rica, I decided to pack a back pack and go there to write.

1089279419867369472.text:
This was about the same time I got introduced to Bitcoin for the first time.

We were trying to buy drugs and our friend showed us Bitcoin and sold us some of his.

I researched it a bit, thought the concept was interesting, but never full grasped it at that time.

1089279418684637184.text:
The struggle between my team mates and I caused me to lose inspiration in the idea.

It was smart and fun. We had VC’s interested in investing. But I felt something was off. 

Or I couldn’t handle the pressure. Not sure which, but possibly both.

1089279417455702022.text:
The project was eventually given up on and sold for about break even. 

1 team member wasn’t participating at a high level so I asked him to leave. He fought me for equity and got some.

The second team member wasn’t working hard either, but he was a founder. Hard to fight that.

1089279416348352513.text:
Being in college at the time, this was a big win for me. Taking something from idea to reality is hard, and I was so proud I was able to do that. 

Also, managing a team was hard. Especially when they are college buddies.

We eventually got around 15,000 users.

1089279415421493248.text:
I received funding from family, managed a development team on the other side of the world, brought the app from idea to reality, and marketed it to the world, all while being a full time student as well.

We were featured in Entrepreneur Magazine, Yahoo, and other publications.

1089279414511243265.text:
My second attempt came when I had an idea for a mobile app - SociaLink.

The app was intended to allow people meeting in person to instantly send friend requests on your favorite social networks like Twitter, Linkedin, FB, etc without the hassle of searching each site separately.

1089279413315911681.text:
I remember writing my first business plan and presenting it to one of my older friends to review.

He liked it. 

So I presented it to one of my entrepreneur teachers. 

She tore it apart. 

This is where I learned enthusiasm was only a part of building a business/idea.

1089279412162433024.text:
In the mess of being drunk/high most of my days, I attempted to organize a few other buddies to build this idea with me.

They were verbally enthusiastic, but their actions did not mirror their words.

This is where I first learned the importance of who I surrounded myself with.

1089279410342191106.text:
My first attempt at a business was a website called College Reg my freshman year at the University of Arizona.

I had a dope idea to aggregate content about crazy stories from college students into one website. 

A couple of my buddies liked the idea so we tried to roll with it.

1088974746472116225.text:
I’ve decided I’m no longer talking about shitcoins as investments on Twitter.

I have spoken about shitcoins that I made investments in during the past. 

Some went up and made me money. 

Some went down and lost me money.

I never told anyone to buy any coins and I never will.

1088974748875481088.text:
If I talk about a shitcoin, it will be strictly related to current news or important development information (or memes).

I will not be discussing potential price movement or speculation.

All this being said, if your goal is to get better at trading, I wish you the best!

1088974747969511424.text:
But the truth is, people tend to blindly follow others and they may have blindly followed me.

Although everyone is responsible for their own decisions and investments, I am still not ok with this possibility.

From now on, my investments will be private.
